title: Reflective Teaching-Based Curriculum for Strengthening Ethical Competencies in Genomic Testing

context.prior_knowledge: Basic life sciences theory and knowledge at an introductory genomics level
context.additional_context: Education conducted in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment, focusing on online discussions, case analyses, and asynchronous interactions.

learning_goals: Explain the technical principles and clinical applications of genetic testing and analyze three or more ethical dilemmas in patient counseling scenarios.
Using reflective teaching methods, establish and implement communication strategies considering personal biases and societal contexts in ethical decision-making processes related to genetic testing.
Apply the concept of Professional Reflectivity (gap-responsive interaction, professional humility, contextual awareness) to real-world cases to propose ethical alternatives.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
